data.title: Reimplements a form of subsurface scattering
dedicated servers are not o/s specific.
Initial commit for the new base template.
data.body: Replaces the Empty and Full templates with a new, re-factored Base Template.

data.title: ShadergenHLSL foliage fixes
data.body: Fixes a few issues with DX9/11 shadergen with foliage.

data.title: Fix up GL formats to comply with core profile.
data.body: Removes some unnecessary extension checks for GL, as those formats are part of 3.2 core. SDL is having some conflicts with extension detection with GL.

data.title: DX11/GL border offset fix for GFXDrawUtil::drawRect
data.body: Pretty much round 2 for the same problem here: https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/commit/e3b228db8bf7c34f205724a55505f9294b2c41bf

data.title: Updates SDL to version 2.0.4, which makes it compatible with VS2015.
CMake SDL Option
data.body: Makes the cmake SDL flag a regular, non-advanced option so that it's not hidden from the base setup on Windows.

data.title: corrects projection matricies for opengl
allows navmeshes to generate for most scene objects,
data.body:
and adds a NavMeshIgnore method for object-instances to filter them out.

(primary usage this end: bots pathing around one another via a cyclic call to the previsouly turned over NavMeshUpdateAll/NavMeshUpdateAroundObject)

data.title: NearClip distance wrong with OpenGL rendering
data.body:
The nearClip distance that can be set in the level-Info object seems to be wrong when switching to OpenGL rendering.
By default the value is set to 0.1, but when you switch to OpenGL you have to set it to 0.2 to achieve the same effect for the nearClip distance.
I noticed that I could suddenly see meshes near my character when I switched to OpenGL, which were not visible in DirectX.

data.title: ScreenShotD3D11 delete fix.
data.body: I'm not even going to say anything lol

data.title: Roll back the changes to simPath temporarily in order to merge in DX11
Fix for SimPath to make DX11 compatible.
data.body: Includes a vertex type formatting fix for the SimPath change to make it compatible with DX11.

data.title: case sensitivity typofix
Added Epoxy in favor of GLEW
data.body:
This removes the GLEW dependency since it has trouble with OpenGL core profiles (and should play nicer with detecting opengl capabilities) by replacing it with libepoxy. 

UPDATE:
Windows has been tested, JeffR (and Az I believe) have tested Linux/X11.  Feel free to merge whenever you want once one of them gives the OK.

data.title: Fix release build compile with MSVC 2015 (finally)
data.body:
This fixes compiling a release build with MSVC 2015. The issue was that the DirectX runtime requires a function that is no longer present in MSVC 2015. However, Microsoft was nice enough to add a legacy compatibility library to continue using it, so linking against that fixes the linker errors and it works again.

However, we have to check for MSVC 2015, and to do that requires CMake 3.1.4 as that is when they added MSVC14 macro. If that is not okay, I can come up with a solution to keep backwards compatibility, but c'mon its 2016. They are at CMake 3.5.0 now :/

data.title: Linux Binary Dist includes only Windows Executables
data.body:
I downloaded the 3.8 Linux binary distribution and extracted it only to find Windows executables. Is this intended? I wanted to build it locally, but it requires cmake 2.8.12, and Centos 7 is locked to 2.8.11. Getting cmake built and integrated with my system is far more trouble than it's worth and potentially breaks the system, so I need to avoid that.

Thanks

data.body: This over-rides the data set here https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/blob/development/Engine/source/gfx/gl/gfxGLEnumTranslate.cpp#L200-L238.

data.title: Spacial update for Px3 character controller
data.body: The testSpacials() and setSpacials() functions have been added to test for overlaps before changing character poses and to update the character controller with the new dimensions.

data.title: codeBlock.cpp: Bad DSO Condition?
data.body:
Just a bit ago I was looking over how DSO's are processed and I noticed this line:

https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/blob/development/Engine/source/console/codeBlock.cpp#L438

It seems to indicate that the engine just inserts a blank into the string table when you've read bad string table offsets from the DSO file. Shouldn't this indicate an error condition that the engine might want to instead ditch the DSO and print an error for? I'm not wholly familiar with how the engine is operating (as this may actually be desirable behavior for reasons I can't quite see?) otherwise I would've made this a pull request.
